model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: I've been teaching my kids how to make my grandmothers jello recipe, it's time to pass it on!
Speaker B: Family traditions are important.  Its good to get kids interested in cooking early.  I may have to lay off for awhile because I am picking up so weight and I don't need the sugar.
Speaker A: Lay off what, jello, or desserts in general?
Speaker B: Honesty, both.  I started to watch baking how-to-video to learn to bake, and I am shocked at just how much sugar in in desserts.
Speaker A: How's learning to bake going in general, especially now that you're off desserts?
Speaker B: I one of those people how have to fail a couple of times before I get the hang of it, but I'm getting there.  Have you and the kids had any chance to go skiing lately?
Speaker A: Water skiing? Yes, last weekend. It was so much fun!

[MEMORY]
Speaker A has a strong connection to jello, particularly cherry flavor, due to their grandma making it at family dinners. Speaker A suggests that Speaker B can consider their grandmother as a surrogate grandma for learning jello recipes.
